title: [Large-scale] Structured Mathematics Activity Design Through Blended Learning: Small-Scale Learner-Tailored Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of foundational math concepts (quadratic equations, functions, statistics)
context.additional_context: A blended learning course utilizing personal devices (tablets/laptops), focusing on the organic integration of online activities and classroom instruction

learning_goals: Learners can complete weekly math assignments (problem-solving/concept review) with 80% or higher accuracy using a blended learning platform.
Learners can successfully design and present three or more math modeling problems applying real-world cases in structured group discussions.
Learners can provide two or more peer feedback sessions based on online learning content during offline classes and create revised instructional materials reflecting this feedback.

resources: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) support documentation

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
